data.title: Get ready for Fall
data.meta_description: Discover direct flights to Sun Valley, Idaho. Explore Sun Valley’s festivals, dining and nightlife. Book your adventure today, we look forward to seeing you.
data.text:
Yes, We're Still Open! | Click here for summer road construction information on Main Street in Ketchum.

Sun Valley, Idaho

is calling.

Get Ready for Fall

Fall in the Sun Valley area is one of the most beautiful seasons, offering a full spectrum of colors, from freshly snow capped peaks to the fiery leaves on the trees by the river. Getting to Sun Valley in the fall is easier than you may think - within 4hrs you can be here, with multiple nonstop flights available to the Sun Valley area for the 2024 season.

Experience the enchantment of Sun Valley's Fall Festivals

Imagine the thrill of iconic music filling the air and the sight of herds of sheep parading down Main Street. Sun Valley's festivals are crafted to captivate your senses and create unforgettable memories. We warmly invite you to join us in celebrating the vibrant Fall season in the mountains. Visualize yourself immersed in the festivities, feeling the joyful energy and excitement around you. Be prepared though, you might find yourself so enchanted that you won't want to leave.

Some highlights for 2024

Lukas Nelson - live | September 1

Ernest Hemingway Seminar | September 5 – 7

Oktoberfest | September 20 – 21

The Marshall Tucker Band - live | September 20

Trailing of the Sheep Festival | October 2 - 6

Jazz Festival | October 16 - 20

View All Events

Immerse yourself in the splendor of Sun Valley this Fall.

Imagine a perfect autumn day, where you feel the crisp air and see vibrant colors all around. Ready for an adventure? Fill your cooler with delicious food, pack your hammock, and gather your friends for an unforgettable journey through Sun Valley's breathtaking aspen and cottonwood forests.

Picture yourself driving along the scenic Sawtooth Scenic Byway, between Ketchum and Galena. Envision turning onto inviting dirt roads, each one a pathway to stunning groves of trees glowing with fall colors. You can choose to relax and enjoy the serenity of one special spot, or let your curiosity guide you to discover more hidden treasures.

Feel the excitement of falling in love with autumn in Sun Valley, a place where natural beauty surrounds you. You'll find it effortlessly captivating.

Are you ready to start your journey?

Let our guide to leaf-peeping in Sun Valley inspire you. We look forward to seeing you out there.

Explore Leaf-peeping

Discover the culinary delights of Sun Valley and Ketchum, Idaho, where local, organic, and sustainable cuisine takes center stage. This comprehensive dining guide highlights the area's creative chefs and over 50 restaurants and nightlife spots. Start your day with a coffee and pastry, enjoy fondue at 8,000 feet, savor sushi, steaks, meatless Asian fusion tapas, and the famous Idaho potato. Indulge in decadent dinners and experience the vibrant food culture along the banks of the Big Wood River. Whether you're looking for a post-workout lunch, pre-theater dinner, or a late-night drink at Hemingway's old haunt, Sun Valley has it all.

Explore Dining & Nightlife

Sun Valley offers an array of unforgettable experiences, so much so that we compiled nearly 50 quintessential moments that capture its essence. To fully immerse in Sun Valley's charm, consider becoming a regular visitor or even relocating. Before making such a commitment, start with our curated shortlist. This selection represents the crème de la crème of Sun Valley and provides profound insight into why this destination captivates so many.

Did You Know?

95% of visitors plan to return to Sun Valley, with many making it an annual tradition.

Explore More Adventures

We're all adapting to this new way of life in our unique ways. We invite you to embrace Mindfulness in the Mountains of Sun Valley, Idaho, to help protect the people and places we cherish. Together, we can unite our efforts and bring an end to this pandemic.

Discover how to recreate responsibly, stay safe, and make the most of your trip to Sun Valley.

Find out more

August 30 - 31

Wagon Days

Since 1958, Ketchum has commemorated its mining legacy with one of the West's largest non-motorized parades. Join us for a family weekend and enjoy the Big Hitch Parade on Saturday at 1pm featuring impressive buggies, carriages, carts, and stagecoaches.

find out more

September 1 @ 5:30 pm - 10:00 pm

Lukas Nelson - LIVE

Sun Valley Resort & RJK Entertainment proudly present Lukas Nelson with his full band. Join us for an unforgettable evening on Sunday, September 1st (Labor Day Weekend) at the Sun Valley Pavilion. Ken Pomeroy and his full band will be joining Lukas Nelson for this special event. This concert will benefit Stella's Shelter Fund, a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting shelters for those in need.

find out more

Sharing Sun Valley Stories

Sun Valley is a breath of fresh air, both literally and figuratively. It’s a place where visitors can leave their worries behind, trading in time on their computers for time with nature. It’s an all-season destination where every kind of outdoor enthusiast can find their slice of paradise, from skiing to golfing, hiking to fishing, and so much more. However, a trip to this small town (home to fewer than 2,000 full-time residents) does require a bit of planning.

READ ARTICLE

I’ve been to nearly every place in the country that can justifiably call itself a “destination ski resort,” many of them several times. By this I mean a place worth getting on a plane and taking a weeklong vacation to. I had visited Sun Valley a few times over the years, summer and winter, but not since they began racking up this lofty title annually, so this year I returned to see what the fuss was about.

READ ARTICLE

The word “ordinary” has never been used to describe Sun Valley, Idaho. This mountain town is cut from a different cloth, and visiting for yourself is the best way to experience its unique and wildly wonderful vibe. From the rivers, mountains, and trails that have honed the skills of local adventure athletes to the cultural and wellness events bringing together people of all ages, this a place that rewards those willing to dig into the good life, Sun Valley style. Here’s how to do the mountains differently on your trip.

READ ARTICLE

Weather In Sun Valley - What To Expect In Fall

In Sun Valley and Ketchum, Idaho, the weather during August and September offers a delightful transition from summer to early fall.

August is characterized by warm days and cooler nights. Average high temperatures reach about 79°F (26°C) during the day, while nights can drop to around 41°F (5°C). The weather is generally sunny and dry, making it perfect for outdoor activities. However, occasional afternoon thunderstorms are not uncommon, so it’s wise to plan outdoor excursions for earlier in the day and always carry sunscreen and a light rain jacket.

September sees a slight cooling as fall approaches. Daytime temperatures typically average around 70°F (21°C), with nighttime lows falling to about 34°F (1°C). This month is known for its crisp, clear days and cooler nights. Early snows can occasionally occur in late September, especially in higher elevations, so layering your clothing is important for comfort throughout the day and night​.
